list.name: Default
list.comment: + Prelim work on ecs: getting map generator to take config and request entity construction via entity manager and a new component factory.

findStrings.find: def cast_heal(): #heal the player if player.fighter.hp == player.fighter.max_hp: message('You are already at full health.', libtcod.red) return 'cancelled' message('Your wounds start to feel better!', libtcod.light_violet) player.fighter.heal(HEAL_AMOUNT)

task.summary: Fixed a whole bunch of code that went missing.
Fixed a whole bunch of code that went missing. Added mouse-targetting spell scrolls.
Fixed a whole bunch of code that went missing. Added mouse-targetting spell scrolls.
Beginning the quest to break out of the single file of the tutorial by renaming main file to 'main' which will init the rest of the game and game state.
Pecked away at a little bit of everything, slowly stitching things back together while also adding the framework of the Entity-Component system.

+ Fleshed out the Transform component. Removed the old corresponding properties from the Entity class that had been from the tutorial. + Some framework for the Mover component (takes a mode of transport). + Moved code from the libtcod tutorial into the Mover.Try_Move. + Added python packaging. + Wrote framework for a game state interface class. This will eventually hold the main loop. + Wrote framework for game state FSM called 'Main Junction.' This will eventually be responsible for swapping states from menu to game. + Stripped main.py down to the bare essentials. Only calls Init.init which will bootstrap everything else (starting with a libtcod console).
+ Prelim work on ecs: getting map generator to take config and request entity construction via entity manager and a new component factory.
